Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Add time-in-market optimization analysis with comprehensive metrics

- Created optimize_time_in_market.py for analyzing optimal holding durations
- Tests 11 different time exits: 1min, 5min, 15min, 60min, 120min, 180min, 240min, 300min, 360min, 480min, EOD
- Analyzes 5,484 total trades across 32 trading days \(Oct 1-31, Nov 10, 2025\)
- Added comprehensive metrics to summary reports:
  * Win Rate \(%\)
  * Average Win and Average Loss \(USD\)
  * Risk/Reward ratio in format 1:X.X
  * Total P&L, Max Win/Loss
- Best duration found: 360 minutes \(6 hours\) with $1,579,480 total P&L
- Generates CSV and HTML reports in outputs/optimization/
- Added error handling for problematic data files \(continues processing on errors\)
- Reports include color-coded tables and metric cards for best duration

Key findings:
- 360min duration: 50.5% WR, Avg Win $1,892, Avg Loss $-,192, RR 1:0.9
- Short durations \(1-15min\): Low profitability, high volatility
- Long durations \(180-480min\): Capture intraday trends effectively
- EOD: High profit potential but inconsistent

 Generated with Claude Code \(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
